TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national of GPE ethnic origin , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . Since DATE he has been involved in a long - term unregistered partnership with Ms ORG The applicant is illiterate . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr Răzvan - Horaţiu Radu and subsequently by their ORG , PERSON , both of ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In an initial letter submitted to the ORG on DATE the applicant complained of his living conditions unsuitable to his state of health . He subsequently reiterated this complaint and alleged the authorities’ failure in the provision of adequate housing in CARDINAL application forms submitted on DATE and DATE respectively . None of the application forms were signed by the applicant ; however the latter was accompanied by a signed cover letter .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was diagnosed with paralysis of the left side of the body caused by a stroke and on DATE with chronic hepatitis and brain damage ( sindrom cerebelos ) . Because of his medical condition , on DATE the applicant was declared severely handicapped by the Commission for the evaluation of handicapped persons , functioning under the authority of the county council ( “ the commission ” ) . Starting with CARDINAL DATE he was offered a DATE pension of CARDINAL NORP lei ( ROL ) . Since DATE , the applicant ’s classification in the category of handicapped persons continued to be renewed DATE until present .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was also diagnosed with epilepsy and severe brain deficiency .

CARDINAL . According to the report issued by the above - mentioned commission on DATE , the applicant ’s condition as a handicapped person was declared as less severe , as his health condition improved .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his partner , ORG , left the parental village house and moved to the town of GPE in DATE , after the death of his father . Facing major difficulties in finding affordable accommodation , around the same date , the applicant allegedly started formulating requests for social housing at various authorities , verbally or in writing through the help of ORG

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in the course of DATE he moved together with his partner in a deserted horse stable belonging to the state which was unofficially allocated to them as social housing by the GPE . The Government contested this allegation and submitted that the applicant and his partner started living in the stable of their own will during DATE .

CARDINAL . Welfare investigations conducted DATE by the social services at the request of ORG for the evaluation of handicapped persons DATE stated that the applicant was living in the town of GPE together with ORG , in CARDINAL room “ inside a stable in conditions unsuitable for living in ” . The social services inspectors found that the above - mentioned housing lacked running water , heating , a toilet or a bathroom as well as electricity .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG published a list of priorities for the allocation of social housing which included ORG and her partner , supposedly the applicant .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE sent by ORG in response to the applicant ’s complaints concerning his housing situation , the prefect mentioned that the applicant was living in a stable provided as social housing by FAC and informed him that his requests for more appropriate social housing had been sent to that institution in order to be dealt with .

CARDINAL . In the course of DATE the GPE finalised the rehabilitation of a building for the purposes of social housing . On DATE , ORG together with the applicant , considered as a family member for the purposes of the tenancy contract , obtained an offer of a social tenancy and moved in a CARDINAL - room apartment in the rehabilitated building .
Following the applicant ’s relocation , the stable was demolished by the municipality .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Emergency Ordinance no . CARDINAL on the protection of the handicapped persons provides as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) With the purpose of ensuring the right to social security , protection of health and education , the adults with a handicap have the following rights :
p ) NORP priority for renting , building or buying a lodgement from the state ; ”

CARDINAL . According to LAW no . ORG on housing , the minimum requirements for a social lodgement are the following : the existence of a space for resting , a space for preparing food , a bathroom and access to electricity , drinking water and sewage facilities .
